articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart
articles.description: He shared details of a March attack in a message group that included his wife, brother and personal lawyer, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Pentagon chief Hegseth shared sensitive Yemen war plans in second Signal chat, source says

articles.author: Liz Lee
articles.description: China ratcheted up its rhetoric in a spiraling trade war between the world's two biggest economies.
articles.title: China warns countries against striking trade deals with US at its expense

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele on Sunday proposed a deal to send 252 Venezuelans deported from the U.S. and imprisoned in his country to Venezuela, in exchange for taking "political prisoners" being held in Venezuela.
articles.title: El Salvador proposes sending US-deported Venezuelans to Venezuela

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine issued air raid alerts for Kyiv and the country's eastern half as blasts shook the city of Mykolaiv early on Monday, authorities said, hours after the one-day Easter ceasefire declared by Russian President Vladimir Putin came to an end.
articles.title: Kyiv, half of Ukraine under air raid alerts hours after one-day Russia ceasefire ends

articles.author: Shivam Patel
articles.description: U.S. Vice President JD Vance begins a four-day visit to India on Monday and will hold talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, as New Delhi rushes to avoid steep U.S. tariffs with an early trade deal and boost ties with the Trump administration.
articles.title: India's Modi to host JD Vance in Delhi under US tariffs shadow

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's leading presidential candidate, Lee Jae-myung, on Monday pledged to push for a revision of the country's commercial act, as part of a plan to eliminate the so-called "Korea Discount."
articles.title: South Korea's leading presidential candidate vows to address 'Korea Discount'

articles.author: Tora Agarwala
articles.description: Two-year-old Sumaiya Ansari, a resident of India's Byrnihat town which is ranked the world's most polluted metropolitan area by Swiss Group IQAir, was battling breathing problems for several days before she was hospitalised in March and given oxygen support.
articles.title: Indians battle respiratory issues, skin rashes in world's most polluted town

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's foreign minister said on Monday that China and Indonesia should oppose "any form" of unilateralism and trade protectionism at a press conference on Monday.
articles.title: China's foreign minister calls on Indonesia to oppose unilateralism

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The paramedics and other rescue workers were shot dead on March 23 near Rafah and buried in a shallow grave where their bodies were found a week later by officials from the United Nations and the Palestinian Red Crescent.
articles.title: Israeli military review into killing of Gaza aid workers finds 'professional failures'

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francis held a private meeting at the Vatican on Sunday morning with U.S. Vice President JD Vance, the Vatican said in a statement.
articles.title: Pope Francis, Trump critic, meets US VP Vance on Easter morning
